title: Raheem Sterling hits out at Bulgaria manager after vile racist abuse mars England game
text:

Raheem Sterling has hit out at Bulgaria manager Krasimir Balakov after he accused England of having a bigger racism problem than his own country.

England players were subjected to shocking racist chanting and Nazi salutes throughout Monday's EURO 2020 qualifying match in Sofia.

The game was paused twice with an announcement being made to fans over the loud speaker, demanding the racism stop or the contest would be abandoned.

Sterling, who bagged a brace in the 2-0 win, took to Twitter after the match.

He tweeted: "Feeling sorry for Bulgaria to be represented by such idiots in their stadium. Anyway... 6-0 and we go back home, at least we did our job. Safe travel to our fans, you guys did well."

(Image: Getty Images)

Sterling also quote-tweeted a BBC story reporting on Bulgaria Football Union president Balakov accusing England of having a bigger racism problem than his own country.

In response to the story, Sterling simply tweeted: "Mmmh... not sure about this one chief."

Ahead of Monday's match Balakov took offence to England players saying they would be prepared to leave the field of play if they are racially abused by Bulgarians.

In a letter he wrote: "What I can say is that I don't think we have a problem.

"In the Bulgarian championship, we have a lot of players of different ethnicities and skin colour. I don't think that we have this big problem like, for example, England do."

(Image: PA)

He added: "What I meant was that in the Bulgarian championship we've not had such problems while there have been incidents in various levels of English football involving racism, which I consider something normal because it's a big country with a very diverse population.

"But we don't have this problem in Bulgaria, I can assure you of that."
description: Bulgaria manager Krasimir Balakov accused England of having a bigger racism problem than his own country
